intro: Fimbristylis pilosa, commonly known as the hairy threadgrass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with hairy nodes along its stems. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded areas, such as marshes and swampy regions. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, which are a common feature among sedges. Fimbristylis pilosa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, contributing to the biodiversity of wetland ecosystems.
